noun.description: The process of being mentally stimulated to do or feel something, especially to do something creative.
examples: Helen had one of her flashes of inspiration
the history of fashion has provided designers with invaluable inspiration

noun.description: A sudden brilliant, creative, or timely idea.
The drawing in of breath; inhalation.

origin: Middle English (in the sense divine guidance): via Old French from late Latin inspiratio(n-), from the verb inspirare (see inspire).
